page.title: 07Trout Farm and Water Mill
page.content: {Alderley Trout Farm,}is by the river in Alderley. The owners work 24 hours a day, 7 days a week. It used to be a mill and dyeing shed. The house is 200 years old. They have 12 cats and about 320000 trout. There are 6 small round pools for the smallest fish, then they are moved to larger round pools. When ready they are moved to bigger rectangular pools. When ready for eating the trout are moved to smaller rectangular pools. They are all rainbow trout, and are sold fresh, smoked or frozen. {Kilcott Mill}is believed to be the only mill in the area still using it's historical machinery driven by water. There has been a mill on the site for centuries. The present restoration has been done to the style of the 1825 mill. The water wheel is inside the building.
